topic.title: Authorization
topic.shortdesc: Authorization is the mechanism by which a system determines what level of access a particular authenticated user, administrator or application, can have to secured resources controlled by the system.

body.p: Secured resources on which the authenticated Couchbase administrators are allowed to perform pre-defined actions, or to view and modify information, are Couchbase clusters, Couchbase buckets, views, and replication.
Applications in Couchbase can access Couchbase buckets and use bucket passwords to authenticate.
